articles.author: The Australian Financial Review
articles.title: Forget 60/40 – a 25/25/25/25 portfolio may be the best bet for Trump
articles.description: The president’s tariff deals and a reduction in chaos won’t come fast. Big changes to the investment landscape may need a radically altered approach.
articles.content:
There is an increasing air of desperation starting to envelop global financial markets, as investors, analysts and commentators pray for a new Easter miracle.
Dan Ives is probably the most famous analyst on Wall Street, a long-time tech bull whose op... [408 chars]

articles.author: BreakingNews.ie
articles.title: Trump says grey skies for White House Easter egg roll mean no worries of sunburn
articles.description: The president thanked the National Park Service for how ‘spiffy’ the event looked and paid tribute to his wife for her work organising it.
articles.content:
President Donald Trump welcomed tens of thousands of people to the White House Easter egg roll on Monday, saying the overcast weather meant no one would have to worry about getting sunburn.
He thanked the National Park Service for how “spiffy” everyt... [3682 chars]

articles.author: Sky News
articles.title: Trump hopes Russia and Ukraine 'will make deal this week' - as Putin's 'Easter truce' expires
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says the Russian army had "violated Putin's ceasefire more than 2,000 times" and accused him of being only interested in favourable PR coverage.
articles.content:
US President Donald Trump has said he hopes Russia and Ukraine "will make a deal this week" as Vladimir Putin's "Easter truce" expired, with the two countries blaming each other for breaking it.

articles.title: Manhattan drivers still facing congestion toll, despite Trump’s Easter Sunday deadline
articles.description: The fee began Jan. 5 and is meant to not just reduce traffic jams but also raise billions of dollars in revenue for New York’s subways, commuter trains and public buses
articles.content:

New York’s $9 congestion toll on most drivers entering the busiest part of Manhat... [2953 chars]

articles.author: Sky News
articles.title: Ukraine war latest: Trump hopes Ukraine and Russia 'will make a deal this week' - as Putin's 'Easter truce' expires
articles.description: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says Vladimir Putin's declaration of a 30-hour "Easter truce" has "proven empty" after Russian attacks on Easter Sunday. Elsewhere, the UK has confirmed RAF jets intercepted Russian planes to defend NATO airspace this week. Follow the latest below.
articles.content:
Putin's 30-hour 'Easter truce' expires
It's 10pm in the UK, midnight in Moscow and Kyiv, meaning Vladimir Putin's "Easter truce" has now come to an end.
That's after the Kremlin said the Russian president has not ordered an extension to the ceasefire... [635 chars]

articles.author: The Guardian
articles.title: Amy Klobuchar calls on supreme court to hold Trump officials in contempt
articles.description: Senator warns of US getting ‘closer to a constitutional crisis’ as Samuel Alito’s dissent signals deference to Trump
articles.content:
Minnesota senator Amy Klobuchar warned on Sunday that the US is “getting closer and closer to a constitutional crisis”, but the courts, growing Republican disquiet at Trump administration policies, and public protest were holding it off.
“I believe a... [4018 chars]

articles.author: CP24 Toronto
articles.title: Trump defending Obamacare at the Supreme Court
articles.description: President Donald Trump’s Justice Department is defending the Affordable Care Act before the Supreme Court – a notable contrast to his first term, when his administration sought to repeal the law in Congress and then refused to defend it in a major challenge brought by GOP-led states.
articles.content:
U.S. Secretary of Health and Human Services Robert F. Kennedy Jr. listens as President Donald Trump holds a cabinet meeting at the White House in Washington, DC, on February 26. Jim Watson/AFP/Getty Images via CNN Newsource

articles.author: The Indian Express
articles.title: Toll on Manhattan drivers remains in effect, despite Trump’s Easter Sunday deadline
articles.description: The fee began Jan 5 and is meant to not just reduce traffic jams but also raise billions of dollars in revenue for New York's subways, commuter trains and public buses.
articles.content:
New York’s $9 congestion toll on most drivers entering the busiest part of Manhattan remained in effect Sunday, despite an Easter deadline from the Trump administration to halt the first-in-the-nation fee.
The Metropolitan Transportation Authority, t... [2750 chars]
